channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8430] Cell decoder/scanner/etc. should not hide exceptions
item.description: Cell scanner, base decoder, etc., hide IOException inside runtime exception. This can lead to unexpected behavior because a lot of code only expects IOException. There's no logical justification behind this hiding so it should be removed before it's too late (the sooner we do it the less throws declarations need to be added)
item.summary: Cell decoder/scanner/etc. should not hide exceptions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: stack Devaraj Das what do you guys think? In a test of new WAL with CellScanner, when calling advance(), Hadoop stream inside HBase threw IOException (EOF, for a EOF test). None of the handling logic was executed because it is wrapped in BaseDecoder (and cannot be not wrapped as advance() doesn't throw), so the exception happily went all the way to the top level.
I'll make it critical, might cause bugs as we switch stuff to use cells
I agree, in a sense. In my opinion we should refactor all checked exceptions out of HBase, but this is major work, and until/unless that, we should not wrap IOEs with runtime exceptions.
Sergey Shelukhin Thanks for finding this. So we need to change which Interface to add IOEs or rather CellScannerException which inherits from IOException? I can do it, np if you want.
advance() in scanner/decoder currently doesn't throw any exception. Not sure if it should throw CSE or let the original propagate. Some other IOException subclasses like EOFException could be useful.

Matt Corgan Any opinion boss? I was going to change the signature on CellScanner#advance to throw CellScannerException (extends IOException).

Sergey Shelukhin I'd think the implementation would catch EOFException and return false out of the CellScanner#advance call?

The latter is an interesting question... there's "last record" EOF, and then there's "where'd half this record go?" EOF from stream. I guess we could catch stream exception and return false for both, at least that would work for WAL. It may not work for every case.
I'd echo Andy, that long term we should refactor checked exceptions away, but if it's needed in the mean time then we gotta add it.

Move HBaseIOException back into hbase-common and then have CellScanner#advance throw CellScannerAdvanceException, a subclass of HBaseIOException.

Patch is big only because stuff is moved around.

Where is it actually thrown?
Also, no changes to BaseDecorder didn't change at least

Thanks for review Sergey Shelukhin Yeah, was broke.

Hopefully this version is less silly (Throw IOE now instead of crazy special hbase exception).
